meanings.definition: Causing someone to become unable to move or act.
meanings.sent1: The paralysing fear of heights kept him frozen in place.
meanings.sent2: The spider's paralysing venom quickly immobilized its prey.
meanings.sent3: The paralysing effect of the scary movie made her hide under the blanket.
meanings.sent4: The paralysing grip of fear tightened around her heart.
meanings.sent5: The paralysing realization that she was lost in the forest sank in slowly.

meanings.definition: Making someone feel unable to think or act normally.
meanings.sent1: The paralysing anxiety before the exam made her mind go blank.
meanings.sent2: The paralysing news left him speechless and motionless.
meanings.sent3: The paralysing effect of the joke left everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The paralysing grip of writer's block stifled her creativity.
meanings.sent5: The paralysing pressure to perform well made him freeze on stage.
